entries: As shadern immolator, except up to 12 rounds.

Demolition {@as 3}(divine, evocation) The relictner bellows in fury, causing the surrounding structure to collapse. All creatures in a 30-foot emanation take {@damage 8d10} bludgeoning damage from falling debris (DC 31 basic Reflex save). A creature that fails its save is knocked {@condition prone}.
The area becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain}. The relictner can't use Demolition again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

mid.name: Aura of Repose
entries: 60 feet. Corpses within the aura don't decay. This aura also attempts to counteract {@trait any} effect that would transform a creature in the aura into undead (counteract level 2, counteract modifier +5).

bot.name: Pounce
entries: The mummified cat Strides and makes a {@action Strike} at the end of its movement. If the mummified cat began this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after this ability's {@action Strike}.

bot.name: Sneak Attack
entries: The mummified cat deals an additional {@damage 1d4} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.

languages: plus any one language they knew while alive

mid.name: Crumbling Form
entries: A decrepit mummy is barely cohesive. Once a decrepit mummy is reduced to fewer than half their Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, they start falling apart, reducing their Armor Class to 15.

bot.name: Lesser Mummy Rot
entries: The damage from this disease can't be healed while a creature still has the disease. A creature killed by lesser mummy rot turns to dust and can't be resurrected except by a 7th-level resurrect ritual or similar magic;

languages: plus any two languages they knew while alive

attacks.name: staff
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d4+7} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d6} cold and cold rot

attacks.name: fist
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d6+7} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d6} cold and cold rot

top.name: Snow Vision
entries: The ice mummy ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from falling snow.

mid.name: Great Despair
entries: 30 feet. Living creatures are {@condition frightened||frightened 1} while in an ice mummy's great despair aura. They can't naturally recover from this fear while in the area but recover instantly once they leave it. When a creature first enters the area, it must succeed at a DC 24 Will save (after taking the penalty from being {@condition frightened}) or be {@condition paralyzed} for {@dice 1d4} rounds. The creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.

bot.name: Channel Rot
entries: The ice mummy can deliver cold rot through melee weapons they wield.

bot.name: Cold Rot
entries: This affliction can't be reduced below stage 1, nor can damage from it be healed, until successfully treated with remove curse or a similar effect. The affliction can then be removed as normal for a disease. A creature killed by cold rot turns to ice crystals and can't be resurrected except by a 7th-level resurrect ritual or similar magic; Saving

stages.entry: {@condition slowed||slowed 1} for 1 round, then carrier with no ill effect
{@damage 5d6} negative damage plus {@damage 2d6} cold damage and {@condition stupefied||stupefied 2}

bot.name: Frozen Breath
entries: The ice mummy exhales a 60-foot cone of razor-sharp ice that deals {@damage 5d6} cold and {@damage 4d6} slashing damage (DC 26 basic Reflex save). The ice mummy can't use Frozen Breath again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

languages: plus any two languages they knew while alive

mid.name: Aura of Peace
entries: 30 feet.

When a creature enters or starts its turn in the aura, it's affected by calm emotions for 1 minute, with a DC 27 Will save. A creature that succeeds at the save is temporarily immune for 24 hours. If the Iroran mummy takes a {@condition hostile} action, the aura of peace is suppressed and its effects end for anyone already affected. The Iroran mummy must spend 10 minutes in meditation to restore the aura.

mid.name: Robe Tangle
mid.trigger: An adjacent creature misses the Iroran mummy with a melee {@action Strike}
entries: The mummy swaps positions with the attacker, and the attacker becomes {@condition grabbed} by the mummy's animated sash. The {@action Escape} DC is 29, the {@action Force Open} DC is 27, and a creature can sever the sash by hitting AC 27 and dealing at least 20 slashing damage. The mummy can't use this reaction again until they've Interacted to reclaim the sash.

bot.name: Stunning Flurry
entries: The Iroran mummy makes two unarmed {@action Strike||Strikes}. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses, and the target must succeed at a DC 29 Fortitude save or be {@condition stunned||stunned 1} (or {@condition stunned||stunned 3} on a critical failure); this save has the {@trait incapacitation} trait.

languages: plus any two languages they knew while alive

top.name: Sand Vision
entries: The prophet ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from particles of sand and dust in the air.

mid.name: Great Despair
entries: 30 feet. As ice mummy, but DC 31.

bot.name: Channel Rot
entries: The mummy prophet of {@deity Set|BotD} can deliver devastating rot through melee weapons they wield.

bot.name: Breath of Sand
bot.requirements: The prophet's Sandstorm is active
entries: The prophet inhales its Sandstorm, suppressing the effect until the end of the prophet's next turn. It then exhales a 120-foot cone of negatively charged sand that deals {@damage 7d6} negative and {@damage 7d6} slashing damage (DC 33 basic Reflex save).

bot.name: Sand Form
entries: The prophet loses their coherent from and becomes an animated pile of sand. While in this form, the prophet gains resistance 10 to physical damage and is immune to precision damage. They can't cast spells, activate items, or use actions that have the {@trait attack} or {@trait manipulate} trait. They gain a fly Speed of 40 feet and can slip through tiny cracks. This lasts for 5 minutes, and the prophet can {@action Dismiss} the effect.

bot.name: Sand Rot
entries: This affliction can't be reduced below stage 1, nor can damage from it be healed, until successfully treated with remove curse or a similar effect; the affliction can then be removed as normal for a disease. A creature killed by sand rot turns to sand and can't be resurrected except by a 7th-level resurrect ritual or similar magic;

bot.name: Sandstorm[three-actions]
entries: The mummy creates a temporary sandstorm in a 30-foot emanation that lasts for 1 minute. Creatures within the emanation take a –4 circumstance penalty to {@skill Perception} checks and must succeed at a DC 33 Fortitude save or be forced to hold their breath or start suffocating (Core Rulebook 478). A creature within the sandstorm at the end of its turn takes {@damage 2d6} negative and {@damage 1d6} slashing damage.

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

mid.name: Waves of Sorrow
entries: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the obrousian's waves of sorrow aura, the creature is overwhelmed by the sorrow that suffuses the obrousian's being. The creature must succeed at a DC 33 Will saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} for 1 round.

bot.name: Change Shape
entries: The obrousian can take on the appearance of any kind of Small or Medium humanoid creature. This transformation increases their Speed to 25 feet and might remove their swim Speed depending on the form. It doesn't change their attack and damage modifiers with their {@action Strike||Strikes}, but it might change the damage type their {@action Strike||Strikes} deal (typically to bludgeoning damage).

bot.name: Drowning Grasp
entries: When a creature is {@condition grabbed} by the obrousian, the creature's lungs magically fill with water. A creature that can't breathe water is suffocating while it is {@condition grabbed}.

bot.name: Flicker
entries: An onryo's erratic movement makes them difficult to target. If an onryo moves at least 10 feet during a move action, they gain concealment until the start of their next turn.

bot.name: Onryo's Rancor
bot.requirements: The onryo's last action was a successful claw {@action Strike}
entries: The onryo attempts to instill its need for vengeance into the creature. The onryo, with their touch, casts a 5th-level geas on the creature they hit (DC 30 Will). On a failure, it's forced to seek and slay loved ones of the onryo's wrongdoer and anyone who attempts to defend them for up to one week. On a critical failure, the duration is 1 month and the creature gains Onryo's Rancor, which it's also compelled to use by the geas. Regardless of the outcome, the creature is temporarily immune to Onryo's Rancor from this individual for 1 year.

bot.name: Vengeful Suffocation[two-actions]
entries: The onryo channels their boundless resentment, manifesting it as a tangled clump of wet hair, a clot of rancid swamp mud, or other disgusting mass of matter in the throat of a creature within 30 feet. The creature must attempt a DC 32 Fortitude save.

Critical Failure: The creature becomes {@condition sickened||sickened 3} and the mass fully blocks the creature's airway. The creature begins suffocating (Core Rulebook 478)

abilities: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

languages: any one language known by the polong's creator

top.name: Bottle Bound
entries: A polong is bound to the bottle from which they spawned. They can leave the bottle only at the will of their master and must return to it once every 24 hours to feed on their creator's blood. Otherwise, the polong withers and dies.

mid.name: Natural Invisibility
entries: A polong is naturally {@condition invisible} outside of their bottle. They become visible only when forced out of a possessed creature against their will.
Shattering the polong's bottle also forces them to assume a visible form.

mid.name: Regenerating Bond
entries: When a polong possesses a creature, the polong's master gains temporary Hit Points equal to the victim's level × the victim's {@condition drained} value caused by the possession. These temporary Hit Points last as long as the possession lasts.

bot.name: Polong Possession
entries: The polong attempts to possess an adjacent corporeal creature. This has the same effect as the {@spell possession} spell (DC 26 Will), except the duration is 24 hours and, since the polong doesn't have a physical body, they're unaffected by that restriction of the spell. If the target has critically failed its save and become fully possessed by this polong before, it gets a save result one degree of success worse than it rolled.

A creature possessed by a polong becomes {@condition drained||drained 1} and {@condition doomed||doomed 1}. These conditions don't reduce naturally unless the polong spends an entire day without possessing the creature. For each consecutive day the polong is able to return and possess the creature, the {@condition drained} and {@condition doomed} values each increase by 1, to a maximum of 4. If the polong possesses a different creature, the conditions end for any creature it previously possessed.

resistances.name: or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical)

lore.note: any one Lore it knew in life

top.name: Thoughtsense
entries: The raw nerve senses all non-mindless creatures at the listed range.

bot.name: Accelerating Inquest
entries: The raw nerve mentally probes a creature within 100 feet, attempting an {@skill Occultism} check against the creature's Will DC. On a success, the raw nerve can {@action Step}, and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against that creature until the start of the raw nerve's next turn.

bot.name: Float
entries: A raw nerve floats a few inches from the ground. As such, it can ignore {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain}.

bot.name: Involuntary Reaction
entries: A creature struck by a raw nerve's nerve ending strike must succeed at a DC 26 Reflex saving throw or be unable to use reactions until the start of its next turn.

bot.name: Synaptic Overload
entries: The raw nerve releases a burst of mental energy in a 30-foot cone, dealing {@damage 4d12} mental damage to each creature in the cone (DC 23 Will save).

Failure: The creature takes full damage and is {@condition stunned||stunned 1}.
Critical Failure: The creature takes double damage and is {@condition stunned||stunned 2}.

top.name: Sense Murderer
entries: As pale stranger.

mid.name: Silent Aura
entries: 10 feet. A silent stalker makes no sound, preventing creatures from noticing them using hearing or a similar sense alone. This silence stops all sound within it or passing through. The silent stalker and all creatures in the aura can't use sonic attacks or actions that have the {@trait auditory} trait; this prevents creatures from casting spells with verbal components or activating items with command components.

mid.name: Self-Loathing
entries: As pale stranger, but DC 33.

mid.name: Undying Vendetta
entries: As pale stranger.

bot.name: Constrict
entries: {@damage 3d8+7} bludgeoning, DC 33 (page 212)

bot.name: Implacable Advance[two-actions]
entries: The silent stalker Strides twice and makes a claw {@action Strike}; they can ignore {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} during these Strides if they advance toward their murderer. If they {@action Strike} and Grab their murderer this turn, they can Constrict as a free action immediately after the Grab.

top.name: Sense Companion
entries: A predatory rabbit knows the direction of its past owner or family (as long as they're both on the same plane), but not the distance.

mid.name: Stench
entries: 10 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a DC 13 Fortitude save or become {@condition sickened||sickened 1} (plus {@condition slowed||slowed 1} for as long as it's {@condition sickened} on a critical failure). While within the aura, affected creatures take a –2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the {@condition sickened} condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

bot.name: Feral
entries: {@action Leap} {@as 2}(move) The predatory rabbit jumps with a maximum height and distance each equal to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions. At any point, the predatory rabbit attempts a jaws {@action Strike}.

top.name: Sense Companion
entries: As predatory rabbit.

mid.name: Stench
entries: 15 feet. As predatory rabbit, but DC 14.

bot.name: Betray the Pack
entries: The hound's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal {@damage 1d4} additional damage to creatures that were once its owner, companion, fellow pet, family, household, or pack.

spells.name: wild shape
spells.note: any form from animal form, elemental form, insect form, pest form, plant shape, or soaring shape

mid.name: Miasma
entries: 20 feet, DC 37

bot.name: Steady Spellcasting
entries: If a reaction would disrupt the siabrae's spellcasting action, the siabrae attempts a DC {@flatDC 15} flat check. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

bot.name: Stony Shards
entries: DC 37

bot.name: Surge of Speed
entries: The wolf skeleton Strides three times, but it's {@condition flat-footed} until the start of its next turn.

bot.name: Set Defense
entries: The skeletal soldier sets its glaive (or other reach weapon) to defend the area around it. It gains the {@action Attack of Opportunity} reaction (page 212) for that weapon only. This lasts until the skeleton takes an action with the {@trait move} or {@trait attack} trait or is destroyed.

bot.name: Abdomen Cache
entries: The abdomen of a beetle carapace can be fitted with a simple hinge, allowing it to open and be used as storage. The abdomen can hold up to one Medium or smaller creature, a Large or smaller swarm, or a similar amount of cargo. The beetle or a creature stored in it can {@action Interact} to open the hatch. If the beetle carapace takes a critical hit by a bludgeoning weapon, roll a DC {@flatDC 10} flat check. If the check fails, the cache is breached, and its contents spill out of the beetle. The hatch can also be Forced Open (DC 22 {@skill Athletics}).

bot.name: Constrict
entries: {@damage 2d8+2} piercing, DC 24 (page 212)

mid.name: Fragile Wings
entries: When the drake skeleton is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, it can no longer fly. If it's aloft when this happens, it crashes immediately but can use the tatters of its wings to soften the landing, treating the fall as 20 feet shorter to calculate falling damage.

bot.name: Draconic Frenzy[two-actions]
entries: The skeletal drake makes two Fangs {@action Strike||Strikes} and one Tail {@action Strike} in any order.

bot.name: Bone Debris
entries: The bones a skeletal titan throws are large enough to clutter the battlefield. When the skeletal titan hits a creature with a bone attack, the projectile becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} in the square the creature occupies (or, if the creature occupies more than one square, one square it occupies of the titan's choice). If the titan misses with a bone attack, instead a random square adjacent to the creature becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain}.

bot.name: Mountain Slam
entries: The skeletal titan slams its mountain sword into the ground. The shock wave reverberates, dealing mountain sword damage to all creatures in a 20- foot line (DC 34 basic Reflex save). Those who fail are also knocked {@condition prone}.

bot.name: Trample[three-actions]
entries: Huge or smaller, foot, DC 34 (page 214)

top.name: Soulscent
entries: The sluagh is aware of all {@condition doomed} creatures, {@condition dying} creatures, and creatures that died within the last hour within the listed range.

mid.name: Frightful Presence
entries: 30 feet, DC 26 (page 212).

bot.name: Ghostly Swoop
entries: The sluagh reaper becomes incorporeal until the start of their next turn, and Flies up to their fly Speed. While incorporeal, they are immune to precision damage, and have resistance 10 to all damage (except force, ghost touch, or positive); this resistance is doubled against non-magical damage. After using Ghostly Swoop, the sluagh reaper can't use it again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

bot.name: Sneak Attack
entries: The sluagh reaper deals an additional {@damage 3d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.

bot.name: Steal Soul[two-actions]
entries: The sluagh reaper touches a {@condition dying} creature or a creature that died within the past 1 hour. If the target is a {@condition dying} creature, it must attempt a DC 28 Fortitude save—on a failure, its {@condition dying} value increases by 1 (2 on a critical failure). If the target is dead, it receives no save and the sluagh imprisons its soul in a small, grimy sack that keeps stolen souls fresh.

The sack is magically locked. Any sluagh can open it without difficulty, but any others must Pick the Lock (DC 35) or use dispel magic (5th level; counteract DC 32). A creature can {@action Interact} to empty an unlocked sack, which frees the souls but doesn't return them to life. While a soul is imprisoned, it can't be brought back to life by any means short of a wish or miracle. The sack can hold 12 souls at a time. Sluagh reapers typically attempt to return the souls to a queen so she can devour them.

top.name: Soulscent
entries: As sluagh reaper.

top.name: Voice of the Soul
entries: A sluagh queen knows any language of a creature whose soul they've devoured and can perfectly mimic its voice by attempting a {@skill Deception} check to {@action Lie}, with a +4 circumstance bonus.

mid.name: Frightful Presence
entries: 120 feet, DC 37 (page 212).

bot.name: Call of the Damned
entries: The queen sends out shriek to all sluagh within 1 mile, summoning them to her. This typically calls {@dice 2d4} sluagh reapers. If the queen is facing foes strong enough to threaten her, these are likely too weak to pose a threat but can assist by fetching items or getting in enemies' way.

bot.name: Eat Soul
entries: The queen touches a {@condition dying} creature or a creature that died within the past 1 hour with her proboscis. If the target is {@condition dying}, it must attempt a DC 41 Fortitude save; on a failure, its {@condition dying} value increases by 2 (3 on a critical failure). If the target is dead, the queen devours the soul. Unless the queen is destroyed, the target can't be returned to life through any means, even powerful magic such as wish.

bot.name: Ghostly Swoop
entries: As sluagh reaper.

bot.name: Soul Theft
bot.requirements: The queen has a creature {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} with her proboscis
entries: The queen devours a portion of the creature's soul and steals some of its ability. The creature takes {@damage 5d8} negative damage (DC 41 Fortitude save). The queen gains temporary HP equal to the total amount of HP the target loses, including any HP lost from being {@condition drained}.

Success: The creature takes half damage and is {@condition drained||drained 1}.
Failure: The creature takes full damage and is {@condition drained||drained 1} and {@condition doomed||doomed 1}. The queen steals a spell slot or training. If she steals a spell from a prepared caster, she transfers the spell to herself; if she steals from a spontaneous caster, she gains a prepared spell of the appropriate level and expends one of the creature's spell slots of that level. If she steals training, she chooses {@skill Perception}, attack modifier, or any skill. For 24 hours, she gains a +2 status bonus to that statistic and the creature takes a –2 status penalty. The queen can have any number of stolen abilities, but only one from each creature.

attacks.name: painful touch
attacks.damage: {@damage 4d6+14} mental plus {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage ||persistent mental damage}

mid.name: Endless Suffering
entries: The type of torture that killed a tormented determines the effect of their Tortured Gaze, as listed below. The damage type listed in parentheses deactivates their regeneration and is their damage weakness. The most common tortured deaths are as follows.

mid.name: Burning
entries: The tormented perished by fire and brand. The target takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage and is wreathed in ghostly flames for 1 minute, negating its {@condition concealed} condition and rendering it {@condition concealed} if it would be {@condition invisible}.

mid.name: Crushing
entries: The tormented was crushed or {@condition broken} on the wheel. The target takes {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}.

mid.name: Dislocation
entries: The tormented had their limbs repeatedly {@condition broken} or dislocated. For {@dice 1d4} rounds, the target is {@condition clumsy||clumsy 2} and {@condition slowed||slowed 1}.

mid.name: Drowning
entries: The tormented was repeatedly drowned, held underwater and pulled back at the last instant. The target takes {@damage 4d6} cold damage and is {@condition sickened||sickened 2}.

mid.name: Impalement
entries: The tormented was pierced with spears or blades and left to slowly die. The target takes {@damage 8d4} {@condition persistent damage ||persistent bleed damage}. (The creature doesn't take the {@condition persistent damage} this turn, nor does it get its flat check to end the damage.)

mid.name: Starvation
entries: The tormented starved to death, denied food until the end. For 1 minute, the target is {@condition enfeebled||enfeebled 2} and {@condition fatigued}.

mid.name: Tortured Gaze
entries: 30 feet, or 60 feet if the tormented is at 125 HP or lower. The psychic agony of a tormented spills into the world around them, inflicting murderous hallucinations replicating the tormented's last moments. A non-undead creature that ends its turn in the aura must succeed at a DC 32 Will save or take the effect listed under Endless Suffering. While it has a condition from Tortured Gaze, a creature can't gain a new condition from the aura but can take damage from it again.

bot.name: Scream in Agony
entries: Each creature in the tormented's Tortured Gaze aura takes {@damage 14d6} mental damage (DC 34 basic Will save). A creature that fails is also {@condition sickened||sickened 1} (or {@condition sickened||sickened 2} on a critical failure). The tormented can't Scream in Agony again for {@dice 1d4} rounds, but recharges the ability whenever they take damage from an attacker's critical hit or their own critical failure on a saving throw.

abilities: regeneration 10 (deactivated by a type listed in endless suffering)

mid.name: Meant to Live
entries: Whenever an unrisen would take damage from positive energy, it instead heals half that number of Hit Points.

mid.name: Resurrection Vulnerability
entries: A creature with a prepared or spontaneous spell that can restore the dead to life (such as breath of life or raise dead) can expend an appropriate spell slot as a 2-action activity to destroy an unrisen within 30 feet. The attempt fails if the unrisen succeeds at a Will save against the creature's spell DC.

mid.name: Rise Again
entries: If the unrisen is reduced to 0 Hit Points by means other than fire damage, disintegration, or its resurrection vulnerability, it returns to unlife at the start of its next turn. It has 100 Hit Points and is {@condition prone} in the space in which it was destroyed. The unrisen can't be returned by this ability again for 1 hour.

bot.name: Agonized Howl
entries: The unrisen howls in pain at its cursed existence. Creatures within a 30-foot emanation take {@damage 9d8} mental damage (DC 30 basic Will save). The unrisen can't use Agonized Howl again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

bot.name: Awful Approach
entries: The unrisen reshapes its grotesque form to move swiftly. It Strides twice. Any living creature that can see the unrisen during this movement must succeed at a DC 28 Fortitude save or be {@condition sickened||sickened 1} ({@condition sickened||sickened 2} on a critical failure). This is a {@trait mental} and {@trait visual} effect. The unrisen can't use Awful Approach again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

bot.name: Death Grip
bot.requirements: The unrisen has a living creature {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained}
entries: The unrisen attempts to destroy its victim's life force to share the unrisen's fate. The creature must succeed at a DC 30 Fortitude save or become {@condition doomed||doomed 1}. While the curse lasts, the creature regains only half as many HP from positive {@trait healing} effects; if it dies, any attempt to raise it from the dead causes it to return as an unrisen. The curse ends automatically if the creature's {@condition doomed} value is reduced to 0.

bot.name: Drain Qi
entries: When Draining Qi, the provincial jiang-shi regains 13 HP.

bot.name: Drain Qi
entries: When Draining Qi, the minister of tumult regains 19 HP.

bot.name: Premonition of Death
bot.trigger: The minister rolls initiative or their turn begins
entries: The minister is attuned to coming violence. The minister uses Stance of Death.

bot.name: Stance of Death
entries: The minister's qi-engorged form allows perfect body control at all times. They assume one of the following stances.

items: Bone Corpse When the minister successfully

bot.name: Drains
entries: Qi while in this stance, for 1 round each time the {@condition drained} creature Strides it must succeed at a DC {@flatDC 5} flat check or waste the action and fall {@condition prone}.

items: Cloudless Void The jiang-shi gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and their claw {@action Strike||Strikes} gain the {@trait reach} trait.

Sundered Veins Creatures struck by the jiang-shi's claw {@action Strike||Strikes} take {@damage 1d10} {@condition persistent damage ||persistent bleed damage}. On a critical hit, they are also {@condition enfeebled||enfeebled 1}.

bot.name: Anticipatory Attack
entries: The vetalarana emergent uses consumed memories to anticipate their prey's movements. The vetalarana emergent's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an additional {@damage 1d8} precision damage to creatures {@condition stupefied} due to the vetalarana's

bot.name: Drain Thoughts
entries: When Draining Thoughts, the vetalarana emergent regains 10 HP.

mid.name: Psychic Superiority
mid.trigger: A creature targets the vetalarana manipulator with a {@trait mental} effect or spell
entries: The manipulator psychically lashes out at the triggering creature, dealing {@damage 3d8} mental damage (DC 24 basic Will save).

bot.name: Drain Thoughts
entries: When Draining Thoughts, the vetalarana manipulator regains 14 HP.

bot.name: Paralyzing Claws
entries: DC 27

woodland lore.note: applies only to the woodland the waldgeist is bonded to

attacks.name: branch
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d12+9} bludgeoning. While a waldgeist possesses a tree, any damage that would be dealt to the waldgeist is instead dealt to the tree. The tree has 60 Hit Points. When the tree is reduced to 0 Hit Points, the waldgeist is immediately ejected, and the tree is destroyed.

mid.name: Forest Guardian
entries: A waldgeist is compelled to investigate the sound of wood or trees being damaged, such as by being burned or chopped down.

A waldgeist that hears such a sound must succeed at a DC 26 Will save or spend all their actions moving toward the sound until they identify the cause. This can't be used to compel a waldgeist to leave their bonded woodland. A waldgeist that succeeds at their saving throw is temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

mid.name: Woodland Dependent
entries: A waldgeist is mystically bonded to a single forest, jungle, orchard, grove, or other similar large, wooded area and must remain within it. If the waldgeist moves outside their bonded woodland, they're immediately destroyed.

bot.name: Lignify
entries: The touch of a waldgeist transforms flesh into wood. A living creature damaged by the waldgeist's lignifying hand {@action Strike} must succeed at a DC 24 Fortitude save or become {@condition slowed||slowed 1} (or {@condition slowed||slowed 2} on a critical failure). Further failed saves against lignify increases the {@condition slowed} condition. Once a creature's actions are reduced to 0 by lignify, that creature becomes {@condition petrified}, except they're transformed into wood instead of stone.

bot.name: Possess Tree
entries: The waldgeist touches a tree to merge with it, possessing it for up to 1 minute. They can end this possession early as a free action at the start of their turn. While the waldgeist possesses a tree, they lose the {@trait incorporeal} trait, fly Speed, all resistances, their non-constant spells, and their lignifying hand {@action Strike}. Additionally, their size increases to Huge, they gain resistance 5 to bludgeoning and piercing damage, weakness 10 to fire, Speed 20 feet, and the following branch {@action Strike}.

resistances.name: or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical)

mid.name: Necrotic Runoff
entries: 60 feet. A seetangeist secretes foul fluids into the surrounding water, poisoning it. A creature that enters or starts its turn in the aura must succeed at a DC 29 Fortitude save or become {@condition sickened||sickened 2} ({@condition sickened||sickened 3} on a critical failure). Creatures that breathe water take a –2 circumstance penalty to this saving throw. As long as a creature remains in the aura, it can't reduce its {@condition sickened} condition below 1. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

bot.name: Putrid Assault
entries: Each enemy in the seetangeist's space takes {@damage 3d6} slashing and {@damage 3d6} poison damage (DC 32 basic Reflex save). A creature that fails this save also takes {@damage 1d12} {@condition persistent damage ||persistent poison damage}.

mid.name: Final Snare
mid.trigger: The hunter wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points
entries: The hunter wight has rigged their own body with a snare, which they trigger before being destroyed. Slivers of bone launch at an adjacent creature, dealing {@damage 4d8} piercing damage (DC 25 basic Reflex save).

bot.name: Drain Life
entries: When the hunter wight damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 7 temporary

bot.name: Hit
entries: Points, and the creature must succeed at a DC 22 Fortitude save or become {@condition drained||drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the hunter wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the {@condition drained} condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of {@condition drained||drained 4}.

bot.name: Spawn Hunter Wight
entries: A living humanoid killed by a hunter wight's weapon or claw {@action Strike} rises as a hunter wight spawn after {@dice 1d4} rounds. This spawn is under the command of the hunter wight that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn hunter wight and are {@condition clumsy||clumsy 2} for as long as they're a hunter wight spawn. If the creator of the hunter wight spawn dies, the hunter wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous hunter wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn hunter wight, and are no longer {@condition clumsy}.

mid.name: Final Spite
mid.trigger: The prowler wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points
entries: The prowler wight makes a {@action Strike} before being destroyed. They don't gain any temporary HP from drain life on this {@action Strike}.

bot.name: Drain Life
entries: As hunter wight, but 9 temporary Hit Points and DC 25.

bot.name: Feign Death
entries: The prowler wight quenches the telltale red glow in their eye sockets, falls {@condition prone}, and lies completely still. Until the next time they act, the prowler wight appears to be an ordinary corpse. They have an automatic result of 38 on {@skill Deception} checks and DCs to pass as an ordinary corpse.

bot.name: Sneak Attack
entries: The prowler wight deals an additional {@damage 2d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.

bot.name: Spawn Prowler Wight
entries: As hunter wight, but the spawn is a prowler wight.

mid.name: Final Spite
mid.trigger: The wight commander is reduced to 0 Hit Points
entries: The wight commander blows a battered war horn before being destroyed. The unnerving blast summons reinforcements, raising {@dice 1d4} corpses in a 200-foot emanation as wights (Bestiary 332).

bot.name: Coordinated Strike
entries: The wight commander flanks with an ally as long as the target is within both their reaches, even if commander and ally aren't on opposite sides.

bot.name: Drain Life
entries: As hunter wight, but 12 temporary Hit Points and DC 29.

bot.name: Spawn Wight Soldier
entries: As hunter wight, but the spawn is a different wight of the commander's level or lower, most often a hunter wight or prowler wight.

bot.name: Tactical Direction
entries: Each wight ally in a 30-foot emanation gains the {@action Attack of Opportunity} reaction until the end of their next turn.

top.name: Slow
entries: A zombie snake is permanently {@condition slowed||slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

bot.name: Filth Fever
entries: The {@condition sickened} and {@condition unconscious} conditions from filth fever can't end or be reduced until the disease is cured;

top.name: Slow
entries: As zombie snake.

bot.name: Sneak Attack
entries: The husk zombie deals an additional {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.

bot.name: Sudden Surge
entries: The husk zombie has a sudden burst of speed. They are {@condition quickened} this turn and can use the extra action only to {@action Stride} or {@action Strike}. If the husk zombie's first action this turn is a melee {@action Strike}, the target is {@condition flat-footed} against the attack. The husk zombie can't use Sudden Surge again until after they spend at least 10 minutes standing motionless.

top.name: Slow
entries: As zombie snake.

bot.name: Ground Slam
bot.requirements: The zombie owlbear has a creature {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} with its talons
entries: The zombie owlbear repeatedly slams the creature into the ground. This deals {@damage 1d10+7} bludgeoning damage (DC 20 basic Fortitude save). On a critical failure, the creature is {@condition stunned||stunned 1}, and on a critical success the creature is no longer {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained}.

bot.name: Horrifying Screech
entries: The zombie owlbear unleashes a {@condition broken}, snarling screech that unnerves those who hear it. Each creature in a 60-foot emanation must attempt a DC 19 Will save. Regardless of the result, creatures are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition fleeing} for 1 round and {@condition frightened||frightened 3}.

bot.name: Command Zombie
entries: The zombie lord intones blasphemous words to gain control over a zombie they can see within 100 feet. A zombie that is mindless and not under someone else's control falls under their control automatically; otherwise, the zombie or its controller can attempt a DC 22 Will save to avoid it being {@condition controlled} (whichever has the higher modifier). The target zombie is temporarily immune for 24 hours if successful. The attempt fails if the zombie is the same level as the zombie lord or higher.
The zombie remains {@condition controlled} by the zombie lord until either is destroyed.
A zombie lord can control up to 8 zombies at a time. If the zombie lord would control a number of zombies over this limit, they choose which to release.

bot.name: Create Zombies
entries: A zombie lord can create lesser zombies with a 1-hour ritual. During this time, the zombie lord chants and performs an unholy dance over the corpses they intend to animate. Unlike normal rituals, this doesn't require a skill check or Cost. At the end of this hour, the zombie lord can create one 1st- or 2nd-level zombie, or two zombies of level 0 or lower. These are automatically under the zombie lord's control and count toward the limit of Command Zombie. Any zombies created by the zombie lord still count toward the XP budget of an encounter normally.

bot.name: Shamble Forth!
entries: Each zombie {@condition controlled} by the zombie lord Strides 5 feet (or Burrows, Climbs, Flies, or Swims 5 feet if it has the corresponding movement type).

top.name: Slow
entries: As zombie snake.

bot.name: Sneak Attack
entries: The withered zombie deals an additional {@damage 2d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.

bot.name: Sudden Surge
entries: As the husk zombie, but the withered zombie can't use this ability for {@dice 1d4} rounds (instead of needing to spend 10 minutes motionless before using it again).

top.name: Slow
entries: As zombie snake.

mid.name: Severed Trunk
entries: When the zombie mammoth is hit by a critical hit that deals slashing damage, the mammoth's trunk is severed from its body. Any creature {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} with the trunk is released, and the mammoth loses its trunk

mid.name: Strike and Greater Constrict.
entries: The trunk slithers across the battlefield, still animated, and acts in initiative right after the mammoth. It retains Greater Constrict and trunk {@action Strike||Strikes} but can't use tusk {@action Strike||Strikes}, foot

mid.name: {@action Strike||Strikes}, or Shambling Trample.
entries: It has all the stats of the mammoth, except its AC is reduced to 23, it has only 50 Hit Points, and its Speed is 10 feet. Damage dealt to the severed trunk has no effect on the zombie mammoth.

bot.name: Greater Constrict
entries: {@damage 2d10+7} bludgeoning, DC 30 (page 213)

bot.name: Shambling Trample[two-actions] As Trample

activity.entry: Large or smaller, foot, DC 30, page 214

entries: Strides up to its Speed instead of double.

creature.name: Harlo Krant
items: bag of holding type I (contains two doses of arsenic

bot.name: Command Zombie
entries: Krant intones blasphemous words to gain control over a zombie he can see within 100 feet. A zombie that is mindless and not under someone else's control falls under his control automatically; otherwise, the zombie or its controller can attempt a DC 22 Will save to avoid being {@condition controlled} (whichever has the higher modifier). The target zombie is temporarily immune for 24 hours if successful. The attempt fails if the zombie is the same level as Krant or higher. The zombie remains {@condition controlled} by Krant until either is destroyed. Krant can control up to 8 zombies at a time. If Krant would control a number of zombies over this limit, he chooses which to release.

bot.name: Create Zombies
entries: Krant can create lesser zombies with a 1-hour ritual. During this time, Krant chants and performs an unholy dance over the corpses he intends to animate. Unlike normal rituals, this doesn't require a skill check or Cost. At the end of this hour, Krant can create one 1st- or 2nd-level zombie, or two zombies of level 0 or lower. These are automatically under Krant's control and count toward the limit of Command Zombie. Any zombies created by Krant still count toward the XP budget of an encounter normally.
Krant has created enough individual zombies to form shambler troops, which are effectively 4th-level creatures.
Rather than creating them directly, he needed to train weaker zombies to work as troops.

bot.name: Shamble Forth!
entries: Each zombie {@condition controlled} by Krant Strides 5 feet (or Burrows, Climbs, Flies, or Swims 5 feet if it has the corresponding movement type).

bot.name: Whispering Scythe
bot.trigger: An undead {@condition controlled} by Krant and within 20 feet of him is destroyed
bot.requirements: Krant is holding his scythe
entries: Krant draws the creature's soul into his scythe. The next time he makes a scythe {@action Strike}, the soul is released and the {@action Strike} deals an extra {@damage 1d6} negative damage. The scythe can hold only one soul at a time.
